lead_paragraph: A fantasy football company partly owned by Dallas quarterback Tony Romo is fighting the N.F.L., saying the league is interfering with a second attempt to hold a fan-centric convention.

headline.main: N.F.L. and Fantasy Football Company in Dispute

snippet: A fantasy football company partly owned by Dallas quarterback Tony Romo is fighting the N.F.L., saying the league is interfering with a second attempt to hold a fan-centric convention.
